headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as promotions boost demand
summary: STORY: McDonald's on Wednesday reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat Wall Street estimates, lifting shares as much as three and a half percent in morning trading.The fast-food giant benefitted from promotions and its affordable meal bundles that drew budget-conscious customers looking to stretch their dollar amid economic uncertainty.Competition among fast-food restaurants has intensified as McDonald's and rivals Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in customer demand.McDonald's in April launched a limited-time Happy Meal offer tied to the "Minecraft" movie, followed in May by the rollout of McCrispy Chicken Strips as a permanent menu item.Menu innovation and promotions also helped Domino's report upbeat U.S. same-store sales, while weakening demand hurt sales at Yum Brands and Chipotle.McDonald's said re-engaging the low-income consumer is "critical," as they provide the bulk of the chain's foot traffic.But the company's CEO added that executives at McDonald's "remain cautious about the overall near-term health of the U.S. consumer."

content.title: McDonald's global sales top estimates as promotions boost demand
content.description:
STORY: McDonald's on Wednesday reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat Wall Street estimates, lifting shares as much as three and a half percent in morning trading.

The fast-food giant benefitted from promotions and its affordable meal bundles that drew budget-conscious customers looking to stretch their dollar amid economic uncertainty.

Competition among fast-food restaurants has intensified as McDonald's and rivals Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in customer demand.

McDonald's in April launched a limited-time Happy Meal offer tied to the "Minecraft" movie, followed in May by the rollout of McCrispy Chicken Strips as a permanent menu item.

Menu innovation and promotions also helped Domino's report upbeat U.S. same-store sales, while weakening demand hurt sales at Yum Brands and Chipotle.

McDonald's said re-engaging the low-income consumer is "critical," as they provide the bulk of the chain's foot traffic.

But the company's CEO added that executives at McDonald's "remain cautious about the overall near-term health of the U.S. consumer."
content.summary: STORY: McDonald's on Wednesday reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that beat Wall Street estimates, lifting shares as much as three and a half percent in morning trading.The fast-food giant benefitted from promotions and its affordable meal bundles that drew budget-conscious customers looking to stretch their dollar amid economic uncertainty.Competition among fast-food restaurants has intensified as McDonald's and rivals Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in customer demand.McDonald's in April launched a limited-time Happy Meal offer tied to the "Minecraft" movie, followed in May by the rollout of McCrispy Chicken Strips as a permanent menu item.Menu innovation and promotions also helped Domino's report upbeat U.S. same-store sales, while weakening demand hurt sales at Yum Brands and Chipotle.McDonald's said re-engaging the low-income consumer is "critical," as they provide the bulk of the chain's foot traffic.But the company's CEO added that executives at McDonald's "remain cautious about the overall near-term health of the U.S. consumer."

headline: Domino's Pizza® Announces Refinancing Transaction
summary: Domino's Pizza, Inc. (NASDAQ: DPZ), the largest pizza company in the world, today announced that certain of its subsidiaries intend to complete a refinancing transaction of a portion of their outstanding securitization debt with a new series of securitized debt. The Company also expects these subsidiaries to enter into a new variable funding note facility.

content.title: Domino's Pizza® Announces Refinancing Transaction
content.summary: Domino's Pizza, Inc. (NASDAQ: DPZ), the largest pizza company in the world, today announced that certain of its subsidiaries intend to complete a refinancing transaction of a portion of their outstanding securitization debt with a new series of securitized debt. The Company also expects these subsidiaries to enter into a new variable funding note facility.

headline: McDonald's global sales top estimates as affordable meal options boost demand
summary: (Reuters) -McDonald's second-quarter global comparable sales beat Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, as affordable meal bundles and promotions drew in budget-conscious diners looking to stretch their dollars amid economic uncertainty.  Its shares rose 2.3% in early trading as strong demand in the U.S. and international markets powered a 3.8% rise in global same-store sales, above expectations of a 2.4% rise, according to data compiled by LSEG.  Fast-food chains have seen competition heat up as companies such as McDonald's, Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among the lower-income households.

content.title: McDonald's global sales top estimates as affordable meal options boost demand

Its shares rose 2.3% in early trading as strong demand in the U.S. and international markets powered a 3.8% rise in global same-store sales, above expectations of a 2.4% rise, according to data compiled by LSEG.  Fast-food chains have seen competition heat up as companies such as McDonald's, Domino's Pizza and Taco Bell owner Yum Brands double down on value meals to counter a slowdown in demand, mainly among the lower-income households.
